comment.author: 45104424@N00
comment._content: I don't know where that is, but it is definitely not Green Point on Pittwater.

comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content: This is Miller's Point (right), possibly taken from Goat Island or Blues Point.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Apart from the regatta, this is a wonderful and unusual view of the 1895 Dawes Point area and the docks before they were redeveloped into the finger wharves of Walsh Bay. Contemporary interactive map - www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview/?pi=nla.map-rm3443-sd&rgn=...

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] A built-up little spot. I wonder how many of those buildings are still around?
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] Quite a lot of the buildings in Lower Fort Street and Windmill Street are still there, from that terrace with the seven uneven chimneys south. Almost everything around Walsh Bay and Dawes Point was redeveloped for wharves or the Harbour Bridge. GoogleMapsStreetView - I think the photographer was up the hill behind at McMahons Point, or high up on a ship. See the line-up of the terraces 6th chimney with the Lands Department Tower, neither of which has moved in the last 118 years!
